trends: There has been one other sighting in Ponchatoula
There were no other sightings in Ponchatoula on or around August 8th 2012
divs: sighting details1. out smoking a cig on my back porch before bed. 2. looking up (easterly) and noticing a bright\pulsating white orb kind of wobbling back in forth and hovering over a neighborhood that is separate from mine and separated by a thin line of pine trees. 3. i thought it was a bright star or aircraft with a bright front light, but soon found it wasnt...due to the nature of it and the closeness. 4. the ufo was hovering over the tree line at around 1:00am. it was just sitting pretty stationary with very little wobble like motion. then it elevated and went higher, but not much then started wobbling in a very small arced pendelem type way(like an old clock hand moves). i watched it for about 10 minutes thinking i couldnt believe what i had just saw, but that i better get to bed because i had a job interview that morning in new orleans and was going to be getting back up in just a few hours. so when i woke up at 5:15am to start getting ready, the 1st thing i did was went outside to see if it might still be there, and to my surprise it was. so i quickly yelled to my fiance to get the f*$k up quickly to come see, when i yelled maybe it sensed it in someway because when i turned my head back towards the sighting direction(easterly), it elevated another 50 ft or so then shot up another 500ft or so in a sse direction. then started the wobbling motion again, then just disappeared in thin air. the sky was a lot lighter at that time(5:15am) then when saw it before bed. i have seem many things in my life and through my 9 years in the army and this was amazing to say the least. i was hoping other ppl in the area saw it too since it was there so long, but maybe not. 5. my feelings were pretty much like, "yep i knew they existed and so happy i saw my 1st one". ever since it occurred i cannot stop thinking about it and want to see more!!!! it definitely threw my interview skills off when i went to my job interview in new orleans... 6. i lost sight by it either just disappearing in thin air or it left at such a high speed my brain couldnt process it.
